summary: toxoplasma gondii (T. gondii) infects mammals including rodents, cats, and humans. infection can be acquired by eating raw meat containing tissue cysts. acute infection can result in pregnant women transplacental transmission to the fetus and severe damage to the fetus. sfactory because serological methods are time-consuming, and false-positive results may occur due to extra-parasitic materials during parasite antigen preparation [11], and sometime cannot differentiate early infections [12]. PCR-based techniques are limited due to long reaction time and the expensive cost of the apparatus. we obtained the optimal reaction condition as the temperature of 64°C, reaction time for 1 hour, the Mg2+ and betine concentration of 3.0–6.0mM and 1.0 mM respectively. the method was proved to be very specific and sensitive in detecting T. gondii in DNA samples. four primers were used for the LAMP assay targeting six conserved region of the AF146527 sequence. the outer forward primer (F3), outer backward primer (B3), forward inner primer (FIP) and backward inner primer (BIP) were designed using the Primer Explorer program. plasmids were diluted 10-fold serially as 109 copies to 1 copy. tachyzoites of T. gondii RH strain harvested from the cell culture were counted on a hemocytometer and diluted as 40, 20, 15, 10, 5 and 1 tachyzoite(s) genomic DNA was extracted from 200 L sample solution with a DNA Extraction Kit (Tiangen, Beijing, China) the reactions were performed at least twice. 1 tachyzoite in PBS was used as a template of LAMP assay. tachyzoites were purified with a 27-gage needle syringe and a 5.0 m pore filter. tachyzoites were stored at -70°C for further use. two sets of the four primers are listed in Table 1. The LAMP reactionmixture (25 L) contained 2Lof the extracted DNA, 1.6M of primers FIP and BIP, 0.2 M of primers B3 and F3, 1 Lof BstDNA polymerase (New England Biolabs), 1.0 M betaine (Sigma-Aldrich), 1.6mM deoxynucleoside triphosphate (dNTP), and 2.5 L of 10buffer (New England primer sequences 529F (5’-CGCTGCAGAGGAAGACGAAAGTTG-3’) and 529R (5’-CGCTGCAGACACAGTGCATCTGGATT-3’) were selected to specifically amplify the AF146527 DNA sequence in T. gondii genome. the plasmid was inserted into pEASY-T1 Simple Cloning Plasmid (Transgene Co., China) spora caninum and Trypanosoma evansi were used 64°C. the optimal temperature of LAMP reaction was selected as 64°C. the reaction needed at least 45 min, and the product reached maximum when lasted for 60 min. the proper reaction time would be 1
